DataElement.preferredName: Patient Oral Sensitivity Assessment Visual Analog Scale Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent a patient's self-identified oral sensitivity intensity on a 10 point Visual Analog Scale (VAS), in which '0' is no sensitivity and '10' is the worst sensitivity.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the assessment of the ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences in oral cavity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue.

Property.preferredDefinition: Sensitivity; the ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences.:Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: The ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._A pain scale marked off like a ruler from 0 to 10 on which the patient marks the current level of pain experienced._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.:A pain scale marked off like a ruler from 0 to 10 on which the patient marks the current level of pain experienced.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
A pain scale marked off like a ruler from 0 to 10 on which the patient marks the current level of pain experienced.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: On a 0 to 10 scale, how SENSI
ReferenceDocuments.description: On a 0 to 10 scale, how SENSITIVE is your mouth now? Please circle the number.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated for NCI CCR ETIB clinical trial
